Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HR1 (Mastoparan; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (92.86%) toMastoparan-VT6L=K=A=21%; I=V=14%, Mol formula: C71H133N17O16; Mol Wt: 1493.932; Mol Ex Coeff: 0; GRAVY:  1.35.Activity:  active against S. aureus (50% killing ED50 2 uM) and K+ effleux is demonstrated.Toxicity: 50% hemolysis (HC50) 50-100 uM.  human RBC: HC50 197.7 uM; rat RBC: HC50 253.4 uM. Less hemo.lytic (Ye et al., 2023).Updated 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Nakao S, Komagoe K, Inoue T, Katsu T.2011
Literature Information.Title: Comparative study of the membrane-permeabilizing activities of mastoparans and related histamine-releasing agents in bacteria, erythrocytes, and mast cells.
